name: packaging glass sorting facility construction | packaging glass sorting facility | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8132/documentation

A production site with a sorting capacity of 100 kt per year and a total life span of 50 a is assumed.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.];This dataset represents the infrastruction of packaging glass sorting facility from unknown land with an annual sorting capacity of 100'000 t.;It includes material for construction and dismantling of the different buildings and sorting machines, and land use. Data are based on information from three sorting sites in Switzerland. The functional unit is 1 kg of sorted glass cullets.

From unknown land forseen for the packaging glass sorting factory.

This activity ends with the dismanteling of the buildings and machines. The dataset includes the land-use as well as materials for machines and buildings and their dismantling.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: european sorting site, based on few information from different Swiss sorting sites
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Based on information from three sorting sites in Switzerland the following technology was considered:;- annual sorting capacity of 100'000 t;;- life-time of buildings of 50 years;;- built area of 5'700 m2 plus 10% of industrial area for vegetation;;;- building halls  with a hight of 10 m correspond to 80% of the built area.;- construction and dismanteling time of 1 year each;;- sorting machines with a total weight of 1000t and a life-time of 20 years consisting of chromium steel (50%), steel (45%), plastics (4%), and electronics (1%);;- foundation out of concrete with a weight of also 1000t and a life-time of 50 years;;- for the disposal of the machines, all metals are recycled, plastics incinerated and electronics is treated in its own dispsal module. The foundation ends up to 50% in recylcing and to 50% in final disposal.
